The claim originated from a well: known fake news website, Empire News, which carries a disclaimer stating that its content is fictional.
The claim was republished by several oth: including En-Volve.com and WashingtonFeed.com, without verifying its authenticity.
The photograph used to support the claim: showing the statue in the Oval Office, was actually a combination of a statue installed in Puerto Rico in 2012 and a replica Oval Office built in Texas.
The expert: s verdict highlights the lack of credibility of the claim and provides evidence to debunk it, including the source of the photograph and the reputation of the website.
